A system which indexes texts can find all relevant texts in response to a query. The problem is to establish the indexation. At present, adwmced full text systems automatically index texts on the complete thesaurus with computed weights. Another way of doing this carl be a person choosing the set of relevant concepts. This second solution is better but more costly and dependent on the classification choices made by the operator. To meet these problems, ANA (Auomatic Natural Acquisition) had been developed. This system automatically extracts relevant concepts from free texts to produce a semantic network. It does not rely on grammar or lexicon but, instead, is based on ,an original statistical method. This research brings about two developments : oll one hand the system is also capable of extracting the simple grammatical structures it encounters, most often in order to improve its performance, and on the other hand this will lead to an automatic definition of semantic classes of concepts, in order to structure the network.
